1757682982.author: Stephen Covey
1757682982.originalText: "Trusting people to be creative and constructive when given more freedom does not imply an overly optimistic belief in the perfectibility of human nature, it is rather a belief that the inevitable errors and sins of the human condition are far better overcome by individuals working together in an environment of trust, freedom, and mutual respect than by individuals working under a multitude of rules, regulations, and restraints imposed upon them by another group of imperfect people." —-Stephen Covey
1757682982.text: Trusting people to be creative and constructive when given more freedom does not imply an overly optimistic belief in the perfectibility of human nature, it is rather a belief that the inevitable errors and sins of the human condition are far better overcome by individuals working together in an environment of trust, freedom, and mutual respect than by individuals working under a multitude of rules, regulations, and restraints imposed upon them by another group of imperfect people.

1757682908.author: Jen Hatmaker
1757682908.originalText: "There is no scarcity in creativity. The world always needs good offerings. We cannot have to much beauty. There is no such thing as too much wisdom and literature and story and craftsmanship. There is room for you." —-Jen Hatmaker
1757682908.text: There is no scarcity in creativity. The world always needs good offerings. We cannot have to much beauty. There is no such thing as too much wisdom and literature and story and craftsmanship. There is room for you.

14607asd0170749959.author: Brene´ Brown
14607asd0170749959.originalText: "If you own this story you get to write the ending." —Brene´ Brown
14607asd0170749959.text: If you own this story you get to write the ending.

1460790640170749959.author: Unknown
1460790640170749959.originalText: "Create something today even if it sucks." —Unknown
1460790640170749959.text: Create something today even if it sucks.

1460790817774129155.author: Gregory McKeown
1460790817774129155.originalText: "If you don't prioritize your life, someone else will." — Gregory McKeown
1460790817774129155.text: If you don't prioritize your life, someone else will.

1460790874799968262.author: Henry Ford
1460790874799968262.originalText: "Anyone who stops learning is old." —Henry Ford
1460790874799968262.text: Anyone who stops learning is old.

1460790944781914115.author: Anna Quindlen
1460790944781914115.originalText: "The thing that is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself." --Anna Quindlen
1460790944781914115.text: The thing that is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself.

1460791051958976512.author: Peter Drucker
1460791051958976512.originalText: "There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all." —Peter Drucker
1460791051958976512.text: There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all.

1460791142388092933.author: Erica Jong
1460791142388092933.originalText: "You take your life in your own hands, and what happens? A terrible thing, no one to blame." —Erica Jong
1460791142388092933.text: You take your life in your own hands, and what happens? A terrible thing, no one to blame.

1460791205776674817.author: Elbert Hubbard
1460791205776674817.originalText: "The world is moving so fast that the man who says it can't be done is generally interrupted by someone doing it." —Elbert Hubbard
1460791205776674817.text: The world is moving so fast that the man who says it can't be done is generally interrupted by someone doing it.

1460791329210859520.author: Chris Burkmenn
1460791329210859520.originalText: "The death of a dream is the day that you stop believing in the work it takes to get there." —Chris Burkmenn
1460791329210859520.text: The death of a dream is the day that you stop believing in the work it takes to get there.

1460791595444277253.author: Unknown
1460791595444277253.originalText: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." —Unknown
1460791595444277253.text: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.

1460791742496579588.author: Jana Kingsford
1460791742496579588.originalText: "Balance is not something you find, it's something you create." —Jana Kingsford
1460791742496579588.text: Balance is not something you find, it's something you create.

1460791793209860098.author: Unknown
1460791793209860098.originalText: "Keep your goals away from the trolls." —Unknown
1460791793209860098.text: Keep your goals away from the trolls.

1460791826751778816.author: Andrew Carnegie
1460791826751778816.originalText: "If you want to be happy, set a goal that commands your thoughts, liberates your energy, and inspires your hopes." —Andrew Carnegie
1460791826751778816.text: If you want to be happy, set a goal that commands your thoughts, liberates your energy, and inspires your hopes.

1460791873807683591.author: Michael Jordan
1460791873807683591.originalText: "I can accept failure. Everyone fails at something. But I can’t accept not trying." —Michael Jordan
1460791873807683591.text: I can accept failure. Everyone fails at something. But I can’t accept not trying.

1460791907198521346.author: Frank Herbert
1460791907198521346.originalText: "Without new experiences, something inside of us sleeps. The sleeper must awaken." —Frank Herbert
1460791907198521346.text: Without new experiences, something inside of us sleeps. The sleeper must awaken.

1460792038664785922.author: Dr Robert Holden
1460792038664785922.originalText: "Your relationship with yourself sets the tone for every other relationship you have." —Dr. Robert Holden
1460792038664785922.text: Your relationship with yourself sets the tone for every other relationship you have.

1460792102049116162.originalText: “The culture of news is a culture without nuance.” - Maria Popova
1460792102049116162.text: “The culture of news is a culture without nuance.” - Maria Popova

1460792194332119041.author: Robin Sharma
1460792194332119041.originalText: "It doesn't matter where you start. Only that you begin." —Robin Sharma
1460792194332119041.text: It doesn't matter where you start. Only that you begin.

1460792300758396937.author: Unknown
1460792300758396937.originalText: "Practice the art of interpreting situations constructively." —Unknown
1460792300758396937.text: Practice the art of interpreting situations constructively.

1460792338435829768.author: George Bernard Shaw
1460792338435829768.originalText: "Progress is impossible without change, and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything." —George Bernard Shaw
1460792338435829768.text: Progress is impossible without change, and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.

1460792468228608002.author: Steve Jobs
1460792468228608002.originalText: "Sometimes life hits you in the head with a brick. Don't lose faith." —Steve Jobs
1460792468228608002.text: Sometimes life hits you in the head with a brick. Don't lose faith.

1460810484496547840.author: John C Maxwell
1460810484496547840.originalText: "Your dreams don't work unless you do." —John C. Maxwell
1460810484496547840.text: Your dreams don't work unless you do.

1460810683986046977.author: Walt Disney
1460810683986046977.originalText: "When you’re curious, you find lots of interesting things to do." —Walt Disney
1460810683986046977.text: When you’re curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.

1460810747512967170.author: Doris Lessing
1460810747512967170.originalText: "Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible." —Doris Lessing
1460810747512967170.text: Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible.

1460810806057050112.author: Will Rogers
1460810806057050112.originalText: "Good judgment comes from experience, and a lot of that comes from bad judgment." —Will Rogers
1460810806057050112.text: Good judgment comes from experience, and a lot of that comes from bad judgment.

1460810855122026497.author: Henry Ford
1460810855122026497.originalText: "Don't find fault. Find a remedy." —Henry Ford
1460810855122026497.text: Don't find fault. Find a remedy.

1460814694516547585.author: Amelia Earhart
1460814694516547585.originalText: "The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity." — Amelia Earhart
1460814694516547585.text: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.

1460822860994277382.author: William James
1460822860994277382.originalText: "It is our attitude at the beginning of a difficult task which, more than anything else, will affect its successful outcome." —William James
1460822860994277382.text: It is our attitude at the beginning of a difficult task which, more than anything else, will affect its successful outcome.

1460822923548119041.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
1460822923548119041.originalText: "Do the thing you think you cannot do." —Eleanor Roosevelt
1460822923548119041.text: Do the thing you think you cannot do.

1460822998882009092.author: Master Shifu
1460822998882009092.originalText: "If you only ever do what you can do, you'll never be more than you are." - Master Shifu
1460822998882009092.text: If you only ever do what you can do, you'll never be more than you are.

1460992477041606663.author: Juvenal
1460992477041606663.originalText: "We deem those happy who from the experience of life have learned to bear its ills without being overcome by them." —Juvenal
1460992477041606663.text: We deem those happy who from the experience of life have learned to bear its ills without being overcome by them.

1460993677937938432.author: Jen Hatmaker
1460993677937938432.originalText: "There is no scarcity in creativity. The world always need good offerings. We cannot have too much beauty." - Jen Hatmaker
1460993677937938432.text: There is no scarcity in creativity. The world always need good offerings. We cannot have too much beauty.

1460993755515813888.author: Jen Hatmaker
1460993755515813888.originalText: "There is no such thing as too much wisdom and literature and story and craftsmanship. There is room for you." - Jen Hatmaker
1460993755515813888.text: There is no such thing as too much wisdom and literature and story and craftsmanship. There is room for you.

1460993833357877251.author: Grant Cardone
1460993833357877251.originalText: "Courage isn't the absence of fear, but an urgent impulse to do something despite fear." —Grant Cardone
1460993833357877251.text: Courage isn't the absence of fear, but an urgent impulse to do something despite fear.

1460993942871105542.author: Haemin Sunim
1460993942871105542.originalText: "Rather than repeating, 'It is awful, it is awful' stare straight into the awful feeling. Quietly." - Haemin Sunim
1460993942871105542.text: Rather than repeating, 'It is awful, it is awful' stare straight into the awful feeling. Quietly.

1460994032146923521.author: Epictetus
1460994032146923521.originalText: "Don’t let the force of an impression when it first hit you knock you off your feet; just say to it: Hold on a moment; let me see who you are and what you represent. Let me put you to the test." - Epictetus
1460994032146923521.text: Don’t let the force of an impression when it first hit you knock you off your feet; just say to it: Hold on a moment; let me see who you are and what you represent. Let me put you to the test.

1460994124954300421.author: Brant Hansen
1460994124954300421.originalText: "Are we going to live in perpetual shock at the nature of man?" - Brant Hansen
1460994124954300421.text: Are we going to live in perpetual shock at the nature of man?

1460994231573495809.author: Elon Musk
1460994231573495809.originalText: "When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor." —Elon Musk
1460994231573495809.text: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.

1460994380659974144.author: Haemin Sunim
1460994380659974144.originalText: "Enjoy the process of learning something new. Don’t do it just for the end. Delight in the means, too." -Haemin Sunim
1460994380659974144.text: Enjoy the process of learning something new. Don’t do it just for the end. Delight in the means, too.

1460994424486301698.author: Walter Anderson
1460994424486301698.originalText: "Nothing diminishes anxiety faster than action." —Walter Anderson
1460994424486301698.text: Nothing diminishes anxiety faster than action.

1460994491863613443.author: Anonymous
1460994491863613443.originalText: "Slow progress is better than no progress." —Anonymous
1460994491863613443.text: Slow progress is better than no progress.

1460994550126694405.author: Seneca
1460994550126694405.originalText: "No person has the power to have everything they want, but it is in their power not to want what they don't have, and to cheerfully put to good use what they do have" - Seneca
1460994550126694405.text: No person has the power to have everything they want, but it is in their power not to want what they don't have, and to cheerfully put to good use what they do have

1460994599078354945.author: Unknown
1460994599078354945.originalText: "If you're not doing what you love, you're wasting your time." —Unknown
1460994599078354945.text: If you're not doing what you love, you're wasting your time.

1460994661737107457.author: David Allen
1460994661737107457.originalText: "You have to think about your stuff more than you realize but not as much as you're afraid you might." - David Allen
1460994661737107457.text: You have to think about your stuff more than you realize but not as much as you're afraid you might.

1460994729852563457.author: Lucia Gonzalez Venzano
1460994729852563457.originalText: "I feel so good I don't mind getting older" - Lucia Gonzalez Venzano
1460994729852563457.text: I feel so good I don't mind getting older

1460994762131918851.author: Sara Blakely
1460994762131918851.originalText: "Don’t be intimidated by what you don’t know. That can be your greatest strength and ensure that you do things differently from everyone else." —Sara Blakely
1460994762131918851.text: Don’t be intimidated by what you don’t know. That can be your greatest strength and ensure that you do things differently from everyone else.

1460994852297089033.author: Miyamoto Musashi
1460994852297089033.originalText: "Think lightly of yourself and deeply of the world." —Miyamoto Musashi
1460994852297089033.text: Think lightly of yourself and deeply of the world.

1460994983725465605.author: Anonymous
1460994983725465605.originalText: "There is an absolute truth out there, we just can't know what it is. But we can believe it." - Anonymous
1460994983725465605.text: There is an absolute truth out there, we just can't know what it is. But we can believe it.

1460995076402802689.author: Sven Goran Eriksson
1460995076402802689.originalText: "The greatest barrier to success is the fear of failure." —Sven Goran Eriksson
1460995076402802689.text: The greatest barrier to success is the fear of failure.

1460995122913419264.author: Unknown
1460995122913419264.originalText: "If you stumble make it part of the dance." —Unknown
1460995122913419264.text: If you stumble make it part of the dance.

1461015749279973376.author: Unknown
1461015749279973376.originalText: "Obsessed is a word that the lazy use to describe the dedicated." —Unknown
1461015749279973376.text: Obsessed is a word that the lazy use to describe the dedicated.

1461015869144764417.author: Stephen Covey
1461015869144764417.originalText: "Anything less than a conscious commitment to the important is an unconscious commitment to the unimportant." - Stephen Covey
1461015869144764417.text: Anything less than a conscious commitment to the important is an unconscious commitment to the unimportant.

1461015918289436673.author: Earl Nightingale
1461015918289436673.originalText: "Your world is a living expression of how you are using—and have used—your mind." —Earl Nightingale
1461015918289436673.text: Your world is a living expression of how you are using—and have used—your mind.

1461015962082177027.author: Viktor E Fankl
1461015962082177027.originalText: "Between stimulus and response, there is a space. In that space is our power to choose our response. In our response lies our growth and our freedom." - Viktor E. Fankl
1461015962082177027.text: Between stimulus and response, there is a space. In that space is our power to choose our response. In our response lies our growth and our freedom.

1461039211155365891.author: Unknown
1461039211155365891.originalText: "Though you cannot go back and start again, you can start from now and have a brand new end." —Unknown
1461039211155365891.text: Though you cannot go back and start again, you can start from now and have a brand new end.

1461039253668851713.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
1461039253668851713.originalText: "Don't be pushed by your problems. Be led by your dreams." —Ralph Waldo Emerson
1461039253668851713.text: Don't be pushed by your problems. Be led by your dreams.

1461039322518339586.author: Dalai Lama
1461039322518339586.originalText: "Remember that not getting what you want is sometimes a wonderful stroke of luck." —Dalai Lama
1461039322518339586.text: Remember that not getting what you want is sometimes a wonderful stroke of luck.

1461039368676667392.author: Unknown
1461039368676667392.originalText: "A head full of fears has no space for dreams." —Unknown
1461039368676667392.text: A head full of fears has no space for dreams.

1461039409491419139.author: Suzy Kassem
1461039409491419139.originalText: "Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will." —Suzy Kassem
1461039409491419139.text: Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will.

1461039445092622344.author: Walt Disney
1461039445092622344.originalText: "The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing." —Walt Disney
1461039445092622344.text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.

1461039536436232194.author: Mary Lou Retton
1461039536436232194.originalText: "Optimism is a happiness magnet. If you stay positive, good things and good people will be drawn to you." —Mary Lou Retton
1461039536436232194.text: Optimism is a happiness magnet. If you stay positive, good things and good people will be drawn to you.

1461039573878726656.author: Bob Marley
1461039573878726656.originalText: "You never know how strong you are, until being strong is your only choice." —Bob Marley
1461039573878726656.text: You never know how strong you are, until being strong is your only choice.

1461039626815082496.author: Booker T Washington
1461039626815082496.originalText: "If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else." —Booker T. Washington
1461039626815082496.text: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.

1461039668770717699.author: Les Brown
1461039668770717699.originalText: "Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on." —Les Brown
1461039668770717699.text: Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on.

1461039742275911683.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger
1461039742275911683.originalText: "Strength does not come from winning. Your struggles develop your strengths." —Arnold Schwarzenegger
1461039742275911683.text: Strength does not come from winning. Your struggles develop your strengths.

1461039878590775299.author: Alan Cohen
1461039878590775299.originalText: "There is virtue in work and there is virtue in rest. Use both and overlook neither." —Alan Cohen
1461039878590775299.text: There is virtue in work and there is virtue in rest. Use both and overlook neither.

1461039967543578628.author: JK Rowling
1461039967543578628.originalText: "It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." —JK Rowling
1461039967543578628.text: It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.

1461040028973371398.author: Marcus Aurelius
1461040028973371398.originalText: "You have power over your mind, not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength." —Marcus Aurelius
1461040028973371398.text: You have power over your mind, not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

1461040098540077058.author: Anne Sweeney
1461040098540077058.originalText: "Define success on your own terms, achieve it by your own rules, and build a life you’re proud to live." —Anne Sweeney
1461040098540077058.text: Define success on your own terms, achieve it by your own rules, and build a life you’re proud to live.

1461040133268926465.author: Roy Goodman
1461040133268926465.originalText: "Happiness is a way of travel. Not a destination." —Roy Goodman
1461040133268926465.text: Happiness is a way of travel. Not a destination.

1461040201023692801.author: Oprah
1461040201023692801.originalText: "Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough." —Oprah
1461040201023692801.text: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough.

1461040230136377350.author: Helen Mirren
1461040230136377350.originalText: "Listen to your instinct, grab the opportunity when it presents itself and then give it your all." —Helen Mirren
1461040230136377350.text: Listen to your instinct, grab the opportunity when it presents itself and then give it your all.

1461040278249246720.author: Walt Disney
1461040278249246720.originalText: "When you’re curious, you find lots of interesting things to do." —Walt Disney
1461040278249246720.text: When you’re curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.

1461040305734443011.author: Earl Nightingale
1461040305734443011.originalText: "When you judge others, you do not define them; you define yourself." —Earl Nightingale
1461040305734443011.text: When you judge others, you do not define them; you define yourself.

1461040384495087616.author: Chris Burkmenn
1461040384495087616.originalText: "The death of a dream is the day that you stop believing in the work it takes to get there." —Chris Burkmenn
1461040384495087616.text: The death of a dream is the day that you stop believing in the work it takes to get there.

1461040422772371460.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
1461040422772371460.originalText: "It takes as much energy to wish as it does to plan." —Eleanor Roosevelt
1461040422772371460.text: It takes as much energy to wish as it does to plan.

1461040466544062464.author: Ivan Turgenev
1461040466544062464.originalText: "If we wait for the moment when everything, absolutely everything is ready, we shall never begin." —Ivan Turgenev
1461040466544062464.text: If we wait for the moment when everything, absolutely everything is ready, we shall never begin.

1461040504632610824.author: Aristotle
1461040504632610824.originalText: "Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work." —Aristotle
1461040504632610824.text: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.

1461040542595227649.author: Paulo Coelho
1461040542595227649.originalText: "Be brave. Take risks. Nothing can substitute experience." —Paulo Coelho
1461040542595227649.text: Be brave. Take risks. Nothing can substitute experience.

1461040581744869376.author: Unknown
1461040581744869376.originalText: "Let go of those who bring you down and surround yourself with those who bring out the best in you." —Unknown
1461040581744869376.text: Let go of those who bring you down and surround yourself with those who bring out the best in you.

1461040624086355972.author: Lao Tzu
1461040624086355972.originalText: "A good traveler has no fixed plans, and is not intent on arriving." - Lao Tzu
1461040624086355972.text: A good traveler has no fixed plans, and is not intent on arriving.

1461040669313568770.author: Seneca
1461040669313568770.originalText: "As long as you live, keep learning how to live." - Seneca
1461040669313568770.text: As long as you live, keep learning how to live.

1461040700011651075.author: Mark Twain
1461040700011651075.originalText: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." - Mark Twain
1461040700011651075.text: The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read.

1461041139885084672.author: Unknown
1461041139885084672.originalText: "It's not about being the best. It's about being better than you were yesterday." —Unknown
1461041139885084672.text: It's not about being the best. It's about being better than you were yesterday.

1461041216120778754.author: James Clear
1461041216120778754.originalText: "Success usually comes down to choosing the pain of discipline over the ease of distraction." - James Clear
1461041216120778754.text: Success usually comes down to choosing the pain of discipline over the ease of distraction.

1461041263243759621.originalText: “It takes 20 years to build a reputation and five minutes to ruin it. If you think about that, you’ll do things differently.” – Warren Buffett
1461041263243759621.text: “It takes 20 years to build a reputation and five minutes to ruin it. If you think about that, you’ll do things differently.” – Warren Buffett

1461041295565090818.author: Jen Sincero
1461041295565090818.originalText: "If you want to live a life you’ve never lived, you have to do things you’ve never done." —Jen Sincero
1461041295565090818.text: If you want to live a life you’ve never lived, you have to do things you’ve never done.

1461041373377822720.author: Lisa M Hayes
1461041373377822720.originalText: "Be careful how you are talking to yourself because you are listening." —Lisa M. Hayes
1461041373377822720.text: Be careful how you are talking to yourself because you are listening.

1461041405309046784.author: Naval Ravikant
1461041405309046784.originalText: "Self-esteem is just the reputation that you have with yourself. You'll always know." - Naval Ravikant
1461041405309046784.text: Self-esteem is just the reputation that you have with yourself. You'll always know.

1461041442604810240.author: Naval Ravikant
1461041442604810240.originalText: "Suffering is a moment of clarity, when you can no longer deny the truth of a situation and are forced into uncomfortable change." - Naval Ravikant
1461041442604810240.text: Suffering is a moment of clarity, when you can no longer deny the truth of a situation and are forced into uncomfortable change.

1461041496799399937.author: Roald Dahl
1461041496799399937.originalText: "A little nonsense now and then is relished by the wisest people." —Roald Dahl
1461041496799399937.text: A little nonsense now and then is relished by the wisest people.

1461055892405690371.author: Mike Maples Jr
1461055892405690371.originalText: "Ego is about who’s right. Truth is about what’s right." - Mike Maples Jr.
1461055892405690371.text: Ego is about who’s right. Truth is about what’s right.

1461056386943442946.author: Arthur Ashe
1461056386943442946.originalText: "Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can." —Arthur Ashe
1461056386943442946.text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.

1461056616984289284.originalText: “It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all—in which case you fail by default.”—J. K. Rowling
1461056616984289284.text: “It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all—in which case you fail by default.”—J. K. Rowling

1461056669320769541.author: Henry David Thoreau
1461056669320769541.originalText: "A man is rich in proportion to the number of things he can afford to let alone." - Henry David Thoreau
1461056669320769541.text: A man is rich in proportion to the number of things he can afford to let alone.

1461063337836380160.author: Mary EwingMulligan
1461063337836380160.originalText: "Wine is two products. Some wine is just a beverage, and it should taste good - period. Other wine is an art form that fascinates and intrigues people. Many people that make wine want you to think that their wines are in the second category..." - Mary Ewing-Mulligan
1461063337836380160.text: Wine is two products. Some wine is just a beverage, and it should taste good - period. Other wine is an art form that fascinates and intrigues people. Many people that make wine want you to think that their wines are in the second category...

1461063400297885698.author: Leonard Cohen
1461063400297885698.originalText: "There’s a crack in everything. That’s how the light gets in." - Leonard Cohen
1461063400297885698.text: There’s a crack in everything. That’s how the light gets in.

1461063450478530560.author: Muhammad Ali
1461063450478530560.originalText: "Impossible is just a big word thrown around by small men and women who find it easier to live in the world they've been given than to explore the power they have to change it." —Muhammad Ali
1461063450478530560.text: Impossible is just a big word thrown around by small men and women who find it easier to live in the world they've been given than to explore the power they have to change it.

1461063516094287875.author: Bertrand Russell
1461063516094287875.originalText: "In all affairs, it’s a healthy thing now and then to hang a question mark on the things you have long taken for granted." —Bertrand Russell
1461063516094287875.text: In all affairs, it’s a healthy thing now and then to hang a question mark on the things you have long taken for granted.

1461063548939878402.author: Elbert Hubbard
1461063548939878402.originalText: "The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one." —Elbert Hubbard
1461063548939878402.text: The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one.

1461063582972452865.author: Les Brown
1461063582972452865.originalText: "Other people's opinion of you does not have to become your reality." —Les Brown
1461063582972452865.text: Other people's opinion of you does not have to become your reality.

1461063607794298882.author: Amelia Earhart
1461063607794298882.originalText: "Decide whether or not the goal is worth the risks involved. If it is, stop worrying." —Amelia Earhart
1461063607794298882.text: Decide whether or not the goal is worth the risks involved. If it is, stop worrying.

1461063654707634182.author: Henry Ford
1461063654707634182.originalText: "One of the greatest discoveries a person makes is to find they can do what they were afraid they couldn't do." —Henry Ford
1461063654707634182.text: One of the greatest discoveries a person makes is to find they can do what they were afraid they couldn't do.

1461063687435812866.author: Carl Sagan
1461063687435812866.originalText: "Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known." —Carl Sagan
1461063687435812866.text: Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known.

1461063749339529216.author: KD Trey
1461063749339529216.originalText: "Hard work beats talent when talent fails to work hard." —KD Trey
1461063749339529216.text: Hard work beats talent when talent fails to work hard.

1461063786811461633.author: Elbert Hubbard
1461063786811461633.originalText: "To escape criticism: do nothing, say nothing, be nothing." —Elbert Hubbard
1461063786811461633.text: To escape criticism: do nothing, say nothing, be nothing.

1461063853714788355.author: Gretchen Rubin
1461063853714788355.originalText: "What you do everyday matters more than what you do once in a while." —Gretchen Rubin
1461063853714788355.text: What you do everyday matters more than what you do once in a while.

1461063888569462784.author: Mary Oliver
1461063888569462784.originalText: "The patterns of our lives reveal us. Our habits measure us." —Mary Oliver
1461063888569462784.text: The patterns of our lives reveal us. Our habits measure us.

1461063924728561665.author: Elbert Hubbard
1461063924728561665.originalText: "The happiness of this life depends less on what befalls you than the way in which you take it." —Elbert Hubbard
1461063924728561665.text: The happiness of this life depends less on what befalls you than the way in which you take it.

1461063977304158215.author: Abraham Maslow
1461063977304158215.originalText: "In any given moment we have two options: to step forward into growth or back into safety." —Abraham Maslow
1461063977304158215.text: In any given moment we have two options: to step forward into growth or back into safety.

1461064021365297153.author: Scott Adams
1461064021365297153.originalText: "There’s no such things as a small act of kindness. Every act creates a ripple with no logical end." —Scott Adams
1461064021365297153.text: There’s no such things as a small act of kindness. Every act creates a ripple with no logical end.

1461064077573124098.author: Carlos Castaneda
1461064077573124098.originalText: "What weakens us is feeling offended by the deeds and misdeeds of our fellow men and women. Our self-importance requires that we spend most of our lives offended by someone." —Carlos Castaneda
1461064077573124098.text: What weakens us is feeling offended by the deeds and misdeeds of our fellow men and women. Our self-importance requires that we spend most of our lives offended by someone.

1461064105981202438.author: Eric Hoffer
1461064105981202438.originalText: "In times of change, learners inherit the earth, while the learned find themselves beautifully equipped to deal with a world that no longer exists." —Eric Hoffer
1461064105981202438.text: In times of change, learners inherit the earth, while the learned find themselves beautifully equipped to deal with a world that no longer exists.

1461064142001901572.author: Dalai Lama
1461064142001901572.originalText: "Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible." —Dalai Lama
1461064142001901572.text: Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.

1461064179486388225.author: Dean Smith
1461064179486388225.originalText: "What do you do with a mistake: recognize it, admit it, learn from it, forget it." —Dean Smith
1461064179486388225.text: What do you do with a mistake: recognize it, admit it, learn from it, forget it.

1461064451692503041.author: Holstee
1461064451692503041.originalText: "This is your life. Do what you love, and do it often." —Holstee
1461064451692503041.text: This is your life. Do what you love, and do it often.

1461064489948700673.author: Epictetus
1461064489948700673.originalText: "First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do." —Epictetus
1461064489948700673.text: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.

1461064522257485825.author: Marcus Aurelius
1461064522257485825.originalText: "Waste no more time arguing about what a good person should be. Be one." —Marcus Aurelius
1461064522257485825.text: Waste no more time arguing about what a good person should be. Be one.

1461064553257529350.author: Will Rogers
1461064553257529350.originalText: "Don't let yesterday take up too much of today." —Will Rogers
1461064553257529350.text: Don't let yesterday take up too much of today.

1461064595397771264.author: Unknown
1461064595397771264.originalText: "Be the type of person you want to meet." —Unknown
1461064595397771264.text: Be the type of person you want to meet.

1461064720773881856.author: Chris Guillebeau
1461064720773881856.originalText: "You don't have to live your life the way other people expect you to." —Chris Guillebeau
1461064720773881856.text: You don't have to live your life the way other people expect you to.

1461064751786565632.author: Andrew Carnegie
1461064751786565632.originalText: "People who are unable to motivate themselves must be content with mediocrity no matter how impressive their other talents." —Andrew Carnegie
1461064751786565632.text: People who are unable to motivate themselves must be content with mediocrity no matter how impressive their other talents.

1461064776793018370.author: Theodore Isaac Rubin
1461064776793018370.originalText: "Kindness is more important than wisdom, and the recognition of this is the beginning of wisdom." —Theodore Isaac Rubin
1461064776793018370.text: Kindness is more important than wisdom, and the recognition of this is the beginning of wisdom.

1461064826076086272.author: T Harv Eker
1461064826076086272.originalText: "Successful people have fear, successful people have doubts, and successful people have worry. They just don’t let these feelings stop them." —T. Harv Eker
1461064826076086272.text: Successful people have fear, successful people have doubts, and successful people have worry. They just don’t let these feelings stop them.

1461064924730253314.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi
1461064924730253314.originalText:
"Paradoxically, a self-centered self cannot become more complex, because all the psychic energy at its disposal is invested in fulfilling its current goals, instead of learning about new ones."
- Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi
1461064924730253314.text: Paradoxically, a self-centered self cannot become more complex, because all the psychic energy at its disposal is invested in fulfilling its current goals, instead of learning about new ones.

1461065078074056705.author: Dwight D Eisenhower
1461065078074056705.originalText: "Never waste a minute thinking about people you don't like." —Dwight D. Eisenhower
1461065078074056705.text: Never waste a minute thinking about people you don't like.

1461091527539625984.author: Zig Ziglar
1461091527539625984.originalText: "You will get all you want in life if you help enough other people get what they want." —Zig Ziglar
1461091527539625984.text: You will get all you want in life if you help enough other people get what they want.

1461134364280950786.author: David Ogilvy
1461134364280950786.originalText: "Fear leads to self-doubt which is the worst enemy of creativity." —David Ogilvy
1461134364280950786.text: Fear leads to self-doubt which is the worst enemy of creativity.

1461134429724700674.author: Charles Swindoll
1461134429724700674.originalText: "We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations." —Charles Swindoll
1461134429724700674.text: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations.

1461134471013359617.author: Amy Poehler
1461134471013359617.originalText: "There’s power in looking silly and not caring that you do." —Amy Poehler
1461134471013359617.text: There’s power in looking silly and not caring that you do.

1461138029880303619.author: Sarah Ban Breathnach
1461138029880303619.originalText: "The world needs dreamers and the world needs doers. But above all, the world needs dreamers who do." —Sarah Ban Breathnach
1461138029880303619.text: The world needs dreamers and the world needs doers. But above all, the world needs dreamers who do.

1461138075929567236.author: Howard W Newton
1461138075929567236.originalText: "Tact is the art of making a point without making an enemy." —Howard W. Newton
1461138075929567236.text: Tact is the art of making a point without making an enemy.

1461138111447146496.originalText:
"The single biggest problem with communication is the illusion that it has taken place.”

 – George Bernard Shaw
1461138111447146496.text:
"The single biggest problem with communication is the illusion that it has taken place.”

 – George Bernard Shaw

1461138322626007042.author: Coach McMillan
1461138322626007042.originalText: "You cannot start the next chapter of your life if you keep re-reading the last one." —Coach McMillan
1461138322626007042.text: You cannot start the next chapter of your life if you keep re-reading the last one.

1461138422064549888.author: Pablo Picasso
1461138422064549888.originalText: "Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life." —Pablo Picasso
1461138422064549888.text: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.

1461138463328141317.author: Unknown
1461138463328141317.originalText: "Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them." —Unknown
1461138463328141317.text: Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.

1461138495888445444.author: Marilyn Monroe
1461138495888445444.originalText: "Sometimes good things fall apart so better things can fall together." —Marilyn Monroe
1461138495888445444.text: Sometimes good things fall apart so better things can fall together.

1461138528415277057.author: Joseph Campbell
1461138528415277057.originalText: "Find a place inside where there's joy, and the joy will burn out the pain." —Joseph Campbell
1461138528415277057.text: Find a place inside where there's joy, and the joy will burn out the pain.

1461138555447611399.author: Toni Morrison
1461138555447611399.originalText: "For me, success is not a public thing. It's a private thing. It's when you have fewer and fewer regrets." - Toni Morrison
1461138555447611399.text: For me, success is not a public thing. It's a private thing. It's when you have fewer and fewer regrets.

1461138722980708352.author: James Clear
1461138722980708352.originalText: "The more you create, the more powerful you become. The more you consume, the more powerful others become." –James Clear
1461138722980708352.text: The more you create, the more powerful you become. The more you consume, the more powerful others become.

1461138761954127874.author: Jim Rohn
1461138761954127874.originalText: "Your life doesn’t get better by chance, it gets better by change." —Jim Rohn
1461138761954127874.text: Your life doesn’t get better by chance, it gets better by change.

1461138803528065027.author: Frank Peretti
1461138803528065027.originalText: "Don’t be perfect, just keep getting better." —Frank Peretti
1461138803528065027.text: Don’t be perfect, just keep getting better.

1461138876802613254.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
1461138876802613254.originalText: "Change is the essence of life; be willing to surrender what you are for what you could become." —Reinhold Niebuhr
1461138876802613254.text: Change is the essence of life; be willing to surrender what you are for what you could become.

1461371701220966402.author: Ian Maclaren
1461371701220966402.originalText: "Be kind, everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle." --Ian Maclaren
1461371701220966402.text: Be kind, everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.

1461371958889631744.author: Daniel Laporte
1461371958889631744.originalText: "You got this. Make it happen." --Daniel Laporte
1461371958889631744.text: You got this. Make it happen.

1461372198732505089.author: Mary Angelou
1461372198732505089.originalText: "Nothing can dim the light which shines from within." --Mary Angelou
1461372198732505089.text: Nothing can dim the light which shines from within.
